gurmukhi: ijh eyk rUp ikMny Anyk ]puhmI AkwS ikMny ibbyk ]jlbw Qlys sB TOr jwn ]AnBX Ajon An Awsmwn ]67]
transliteration: Jih Ek Roop Kinne Anek|| Puhmiakaadh Kinne Bibek|| Jalbaa Thales Sabh Thaur Jaan|| Anbhay Ajon An Aasmaan||67||
translation: He who created many beings from one and with His Power of wisdom, created the earth and the sky; that fearless, birthless and beyond desires is there at all the places in water and on plain.67.

gurmukhi: pwvn pRis`D prmM punIq ]Awjwn bwhu AnBau AjIq ]prmM pRis`D pUrx purwx ]rwjwn rwj BogI mhwx ]68]
transliteration: Paavan Prasiddh Parman Pouneet|| Aajaan Baah(u) Anbhau Ajeet|| Paramannd Prasiddh Pooran|| Raajaan Raaj Bhogimahaan||68||
translation: He is supremely immaculate, sacred, pure, long-armed, fearless and unconquerable; He is the supremely eminent Purusha, the Sovereign of Sovereign and the great enjoyer.68.

gurmukhi: AniC`j qyj AnBX pRkws ]KVgn spMn prmM pRBws ]AwBw AnMq brnI n jwie ]iPr iPro srb miq ko clwie ]69]
transliteration: Anchhijj Tej Anbhaya Prakaas|| Khadgann Sapann Paramannd Prabhaas|| Aabhaa Anant Barnina Jaae|| Phir Phiro Sarab Mat(i) Ko Chlaae||69||
translation: That Lord has indestructible Lustre, Light-incarnation, Dagger-wielder and is eminent glorious; His infinite glory is indescribable; He Pervades in all the religions.69.

gurmukhi: sBhU bKwn ijh nyq nyq ]AklMk rUp AwBw Amyq ]srbM smiRD ijh pwn lwg ]ijh nwm lyq sB pwp Bwg ]70]
transliteration: Sabh-hoo Bakhaan Jih Net Net|| Akalank Roop Aabhaa Amet|| Saraban Samridh Jih Paan Laag|| Jih Naam Let Sabh Paap Bhaag||70||
translation: Whom all call “Neti, neti” (not this, not this), the powers of all kinds abide at the feet of that Blemishless and Beauty-incarnate Lord; and all the sins fly away with the remembrance of His Name.70.

gurmukhi: gun sIl swD qwko suBwie ]ibn qws Srin nih ko aupwie ]dInn auDwrix jws bwn ]koaU kho kYsy eI lyq mwn ]71]
transliteration: Goun Saal Saadh Taako Soubhaae|| Bin Taas Sharan(i) Nah(i) Ko Oupaae|| Deenan Udhaaran(i) Jaas Baan|| Ko( i)  Kaho Kaise Ilet Maan||71||
translation: He has the temperament, qualities and gentleness like the saints and there is no other measure of achieving salvation without going under His shelter; He acts for the redemption of the lowly and if anyone calls Him with any motive, He accepts his saying.7

gurmukhi: AklMk rUp AniC`j qyj ]Awsn Afol suB suBR syj ]Angnq jws gun m`iD soB ]liK S`qR imqR ijh rhq loB ]72]
transliteration: Akalank Roop Anchhijj Tej|| Aasan Adol Soubh Soubhra Sej|| An-hanat Gads Goun Maddh(i) Sobh|| Lakh(i) Shattra Mitra Jih Rahat Lobh||72||
translation: The enemies and friends all are allured to see Him, Who is blemishless, Who is eternally glorious, Who is seated on a stable seat and Who has infinite qualities.72.

gurmukhi: ijh S`qR imqR sm eyk jwn ]ausqqI inMd ijh eyk mwn ]Awsn Afol AniC`j rUp ]prmM pivqR BUpwx BUp ]
transliteration: Jih Shattra Mita Sam Ek Jaan|| Oustatinind Jih Ek Maan|| Aasan Adol Anchhijj Roop|| Paramannd Pavitra Bhoopaan Bhoop||73||
translation: He considers enemies and friends alike, and also comprehends the praise and slander alike; He is seated on a stable seat; He is supremely Beauty-incranate and also immaculate; He is the Sovereign of sovereigns.73.

gurmukhi: ijhbw suDwn Kgau`D soih ]Aivlok deIq Aru dyv moih ]ibn bYr rUp AnBv pRkws ]AniC`j gwq ins idn inrws ]74]
transliteration: Jihbaa Sudhaan Khaguddh Soh(i)|| Avilok Daeet Ar(u) Dev Moh(i)||bin Bair Roop Anbhav Prakaas|| Anchhijj Gadt Nis Din Niraas||74||
translation: His tongue showers ambrosia; all the gods and demons are fascinated by Himp He is devoid of enmity and Light-incarnate; His body is indestructible and is impartial all the time.74.

gurmukhi: duiq Awid AMiq eykY smwn ]KVgn spMin sB ibD inDwn ]soBw su bhuq qn jws soB ]duiq dyiK j`C gMDR`b loB ]75]
transliteration: Dout(i) Aadh Ant(i) Ekai Samaan|| Khadgann Sapann(i) Sabh Bidh Nidhaan|| Sobhaa Su Bahout Tan Jaas Sobh|| Dout(i) Dekh(i) Jachchh Gaddhrabb Lobh||75||
translation: His Glory remains the same in the beginning and at the end and is accomplished with all kinds of powers; all the beauties are there in his body and seing his comeliness the Yakshas and Gandharvas are allured.75.

gurmukhi: AnBMg AMg AnBv pRkws ]psrI jg`q ijh jIv rws ]ik`ny su jIv jil Qil Anyk ]AMqih smyX Pun rUp eyk ]76]
transliteration: Anbhan An Anbhav Prakaas|| Pasarijagadt Jih Jeev Raas|| Kinne Su Jeev Jal(i) Thal(i) Anek|| Antah(i) Smeya Phoun Roop Ek||76||
translation: His limbs are indestructible; that Lord is the manifestation of cognition; because of His Grave, the beings are scattered over the whole world; He had created many beings in water and on plain and He ultimately merges everyone in His Form.76.

gurmukhi: ijh CUAw nYk nhI kwlu jwl ]CÍY skw pwp nhI kaun kwl ]AwiC`j qyj AnBUq gwq ]eykY srUp ins idn pRBwq ]77]
transliteration: Jih Chhodhaa Naik Nahikaal(u) Jaal|| Chhvai Sakaa Paap Nahikaoun Kaal|| Aachhijj Tej Anbhoot Gadt|| Ekai Saroop Nis Din Prabhaat||77||
translation: The death and sin have not been able to touch Him at any time; the Lord of that indestructible Lustre and body remains the same at all times.77.

gurmukhi: ieh BwNq d`q AsqoqR pwT ]muK pVq AC gXo pwp nwT ]ko skY brn mihmw Apwr ]sMCyp kIn qw qy aucwr ]78]
transliteration: Eh Bhaat Datt Astotra Paath|| Moukh Padat Achh Gado Paap Naath|| Ko Sakai Baran Mahimaa Apaar|| Sanchhep Keen Taate Ouchaar||78||
translation: In this way, Dutt recited the eulogy and by this recitation, all the sins fled away; who can describe his infinite greatness?, therefore I have said it in brief.78.

gurmukhi: jy krY pqR kwimpI srb ]il`Ky gxyS kr kY su grb ]msu srb isMD lyKn bnys ]nhI qidp AMiq kih skY sysu ]79]
transliteration: Je Darai Patra Kaasipisarab|| Likhe Gadesh Kar Kais U Gadab|| Mas(u) Sarab Sindh Likhan Banes|| Nahitadip Ant(i) Kah(i) Sakai Ses(u)||79||
translation: If the whole earth becomes the paper and Ganesha is the proud writer; all the oceans become the ink and all the forests become the pens and Sheshnaga makes a description of the Lord from his thousand mouths, then also he mystery of the Lord cannot be comp

gurmukhi: jau krY bYT bHmw aucwr ]nhI qidp qyj pwXMq pwr ]muK shMs nwm Pxpiq rVMq ]nhI qidp qws pwXMq AMq ]80]
transliteration: Jau Darai Baeeth Brahmaa Ouchaar|| Nahiradip Tej Paayant Paar|| Moukh Sahans Naam Phanpat(i) Radant|| Nahi Tadip Taas Paayant Ant||80||
translation: If Brahma also utters His Glory, then also His effulgence cannot be comprehended; if Sheshnaga also utters His Names from his thousand mouths, then also His end cannot be known.80.
